verb.description: Claim or assert that someone has done something illegal or wrong, typically without proof that this is the case.
examples: he alleged that he had been assaulted
he is alleged to have assaulted five men
the offenses are alleged to have been committed outside the woman's home

origin: Middle English (in the sense declare on oath): from Old French esligier, based on Latin lis, lit- lawsuit; confused in sense with Latin allegare allege.
